content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs the user, I received a response from executing the Python file "authenticate_twitter_api.py" which returned an error message indicating that I was unauthorized. In response, I wrote the Twitter V2 API authentication code to a file named "twitter_keys.txt" using the "write_to_file" command with the specified filename and text.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/authenticate_twitter_api.py", "text": "# Use Twitter V2 API to authenticate using credentials in file /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/twitter_keys.txt\\n\\nimport os\\nimport requests\\n\\nAPI_KEY = \\"your_api_key_here\\"\\nAPI_SECRET_KEY = \\"your_api_secret_key_here\\"\\nACCESS_TOKEN = \\"your_access_token_here\\"\\nACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET = \\"your_access_token_secret_here\\"\\n\\nbearer_token_url = \'https://api.twitter.com/oauth2/token\'\\nbearer_token_headers = {\\n    \'Content-Type\': \'application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=UTF-8\',\\n    \'Authorization\': \'Basic \'+os.environ[\'TWITTER_BEARER_TOKEN\']\\n}\\nbearer_token_data = {\\n    \'grant_type\': \'client_credentials\'\\n}\\n\\nbearer_token_response = requests.post(bearer_token_url, headers=bearer_token_headers, data=bearer_token_data)\\nbearer_token = bearer_token_response.json()[\'access_token\']\\n\\nheaders = {\\n    \\"Authorization\\": f\\"Bearer {bearer_token}\\"\\n}\\n\\nresponse = requests.get(\\"https://api.twitter.com/2/users/2244994945\\", headers=headers)\\n\\nprint(response.json())"}}}'}]
"""
